intro: Liabum amphothrix, commonly known as the rock cress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its small, cruciform flowers that typically bloom in early spring. The plant has a low-growing habit with hairy stems and linear leaves that are often arranged alternately. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine or arctic environments. Liabum amphothrix is adapted to cold climates and is considered a hardy perennial species.
